alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:19AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Custer County through 315 AM MDT... At 218 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Miles City, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail, along with very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Locate and Strawberry Hill Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM MDT for southeastern Montana.
